thread.title: Carl Bernstein: ‘Remarkable’ Hypocrisy from House Intel Members Decrying Leaks of Classified Info
thread.title_full: Carl Bernstein: ‘Remarkable’ Hypocrisy from House Intel Members Decrying Leaks of Classified Info

author: Josh Feldman
title: Carl Bernstein: ‘Remarkable’ Hypocrisy from House Intel Members Decrying Leaks of Classified Info
text:
Carl Bernstein: ‘Remarkable’ Hypocrisy from House Intel Members Decrying Leaks of Classified Info by Josh Feldman | 1:45 pm, March 20th, 2017 
Veteran journalist Carl Bernstein said during the House Intelligence Committee hearing today that there’s some hypocrisy in the complaints from committee members about leaks of classified information. 
Among the many issues addressed at today’s hearing, FBI Director James Comey got a number of questions today about leaks of classified information to the press, especially from Trey Gowdy . 
Bernstein tweeted that “many intel members” decrying such leaks have “knowingly” leaked classified information themselves, and he mentioned Gowdy by name in the context of the Benghazi investigation: I can state w/confidence that many intel members now decrying 'leaks' of classified info have themselves 'leaked' classified info knowingly 
— Carl Bernstein (@carlbernstein) March 20, 2017 Hypocrisy re these members –from both parties– decrying classified 'leaks' in context of this hearing remarkable. 
— Carl Bernstein (@carlbernstein) March 20, 2017 Prime example of wholesale classified 'leaking' to press by members of congress (and hypocrisy): Gowdy Committee Benghazi investigation. 
— Carl Bernstein (@carlbernstein) March 20, 2017 
[ image via screengrab ]
